title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.5.32 | 08-10-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: O Brahmana Vyasa Deva, it is decided by the learned that the best remedial measure for removing all troubles and miseries is to dedicate one's activities to the service of the Supreme Lord Personality of God.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam, stating that dedicating activities to the Supreme Lord is the best way to remove troubles and miseries.
segments.transcript: In this session we will be discussing from the 32nd verse of the 5th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam. एतज सम्सूचितं ब्रह्मन् तापत्रयचिकित्सितं यदीश्वरे भगवती कर्मब्रह्मणि भावितं The meaning of this verse is, O Brahmana Vyasa Deva, it is decided by the learned that the best remedial measure for removing all troubles and miseries is to dedicate one's activities to the service of the Supreme Lord Personality of God. ओऽडेड श्री कृष्णा

segments.key_quote: But please understand that happiness experienced in material existence, which is called as material happiness, is described in the scriptures as simply another form of misery only.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that material happiness is ultimately another form of misery, arising from the contact of senses with sense objects.
segments.transcript: So here is the conclusion of the instruction by the Bhaktivedantas to Narada. Narada is addressing Vyasa Deva, telling about his previous life and he is telling it is decided by the learned ओडेड श्री कृष्णा This is a remedial measure for removing all troubles and miseries. This is because, from the scriptures we understand, and by our personal experience also, we have knowledge about the miseries of this material existence. Now, people may not disagree that there are miseries, but they will say there are also good things. There is happiness and there is distress, both are there. But please understand that happiness experienced in material existence, which is called as material happiness, is described in the scriptures as simply another form of misery only. This is a very, very shocking revelation, but it's a fact. What is the nature of this happiness which we experience in this material world? It is called samsparsha-bhoga. Samsparsha means contact. Contact of the senses with the sense object. For the eyes it is form, for the ears it is sound, for the nose it is smell or fragrance, for the tongue it is taste, and for the sense of touch it is the touch sensation itself, for the perception of the sense of touch. So, this contact produces a kind of feeling in the mind, and that is interpreted as happiness or distress according to one's conditioning. Anyway, it's a very detailed subject, which I don't want to go into details now.

segments.key_quote: To dedicate one's activities to the service of the Supreme Lord Personality of God.
segments.summary: The speaker reiterates that dedicating all activities to Krishna is the best remedial measure for removing miseries.
segments.transcript: But please understand, the essence of material existence is miseries. And generally, for most people, when there is absence of misery, or they get relief from some misery, immediate misery, then they consider that as happiness. Real happiness is something else, different from what we expect. So, therefore, the best remedial measure for removing all troubles and miseries, that is being told here. And this is a very, very important point for everyone to note. It is a very practical utility for everyone in this world. What is it? To dedicate one's activities to the service of the Supreme Lord Personality of God.

segments.key_quote: But they do not know that without the sanction of the Supreme Lord, nobody can become free from miseries.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that freedom from misery requires the sanction of the Supreme Lord, drawing from Narada Muni's personal experience.
segments.transcript: Dedicate all your activities to Krishna, and thereby you become free from all miseries. How does it work? Srila Prabhupada explains in the purport that Narada Muni, from his personal experience, he is telling that simply sit and hear the transcendental activities of the Lord, and thereby you become from the right source, from the bona fide source, and thereby you become completely free from all miseries. Now, what if somebody is not able to do that? For that, Narada Muni is giving another solution. People may say, I am very busy working for maintaining my family, for my own maintenance. So, I don't have time to sit and hear. Even if I am able to hear, I can hear a little. I can't hear all the time. So, for such people whose time is mainly engaged in some work for the sake of maintenance, bodily maintenance, or for some responsibility, or duty, for such people, Narada Muni is telling that you have to learn from devotees how to dedicate your activities in the service of Krishna. How to do that? So, Prabhupada explains in the purport that generally people in this world are struggling very hard to get rid of miseries. Nobody wants miseries. Nobody wants suffering. But they do not know that without the sanction of the Supreme Lord, nobody can become free from miseries.

segments.key_quote: So, the point is that sanction of the Supreme Lord is very much necessary for the treatment to be effective.
segments.summary: The speaker provides examples of medical treatment and crossing a river to illustrate that the sanction of the Supreme Lord is necessary for success.
segments.transcript: So, three examples are given specifically to illustrate this point: that to cure a patient by medical treatment is useless if it is not sanctioned by the Lord. So, we know that doctors do help by giving some treatment to a patient who has got an infection or a disease. But doctor also is helpless if the patient does not survive the treatment. If the patient doesn't survive the treatment, then the doctor is helpless. Or the particular remedy doesn't work, then the doctor is helpless. So, the point is that sanction of the Supreme Lord is very much necessary for the treatment to be effective. Similarly, another example that is given, to cross the river or the ocean by a suitable boat is no remedial measure if the remedy is not sanctioned by the Lord. So, therefore, the ultimate sanctioning officer is the Supreme Lord

segments.key_quote: So, therefore, we should learn how to dedicate whatever activities we may do to the Supreme Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of understanding the Lord's presence and power, and learning to dedicate all activities to Him, especially through studying how His energies work.
segments.transcript: and we must therefore dedicate our activities to the Supreme Lord for ultimate success. Now, how to do that? First of all, we should understand the Lord is present everywhere and He is all-knowing and He is all-powerful. Omnipotent, omniscient and omnipresent. Present everywhere, He is all-knowing and He is all-powerful. So, therefore, we should learn how to dedicate whatever activities we may do to the Supreme Lord. Whatever one may be, how should one dedicate whatever activity one is doing? So, Prabhupada gives specific examples here. If one is a learned scholar or a learned scientist or a philosopher or poet, he should employ his learning to establish the supremacy of the Lord. This is the purpose of all knowledge, all learning, especially by those who are scholars or scientists or philosophers or poets. They should try to study how the energy of the Lord is working in every sphere of life. The Lord is there, Krishna is there and His energies are there. So, in every sphere of life, the Lord's energies are working. So, try to study that. That is what is presented in the Bhagavad Gita. Especially in the Bhagavad Gita, how the Lord's energies are working in every sphere of life.

segments.key_quote: They should try to study how the energy of the Lord is working in every sphere of life.
segments.summary: The speaker explains how different individuals, such as scholars, scientists, and warriors, can dedicate their activities to the Lord, using Arjuna as an example.
segments.transcript: Srila Prabhupada further says, do not decry Him. Do not try to become like Him. Do not try to take His position simply by some little knowledge. No. So, one should actually understand the glories of the Lord in terms of how His energies are working in every sphere of life. And establish the supremacy of the Lord through one's writings, through one's knowledge, through one's descriptions, through enlightening others who are ignorant, etc. Next, Prabhupada says, if one is an administrator or a statesman or a warrior or a politician, that is a Kshatriya, then one should try to establish the Lord's supremacy in statesmanship. Fight for the cause of the Lord as Sri Arjuna did. A warrior should fight for the cause of the Lord. So, regarding Arjuna, it is particularly mentioned here that in the beginning, Arjuna declined to fight. But when he was convinced by the Lord that the fighting was necessary, then Arjuna changed his decision and fought for the cause of the Lord. Karishye Vachanam Tava, I'll simply follow your instructions, your directions.

segments.key_quote: Think always that the money which is accumulated is the wealth of the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses how businessmen and even those engaged in menial work can dedicate their activities to the Lord, emphasizing the importance of chanting Hare Krishna.
segments.transcript: So, similarly, if one is a businessman or an industrialist, an agriculturist, then one should spend his hard-earned money for the cause of the Lord. How can one do this? Think always that the money which is accumulated is the wealth of the Lord. Because wealth is considered Lakshmi or goddess of fortune. And Lord of Lakshmi is Narayana, the Supreme Personality of Godhead, husband of Lakshmi. So, try to engage the wealth in the service of Lord Narayana and be happy. That is the way to realize the Lord in every sphere of life. Either one works like a Brahmana, Kshatriya, Vaishya or even a Shudra. Shudra is one who does some menial work for getting some maintenance. So, even whatever menial activities one may do, one should try to do it as a service to the Lord. One should think that I am engaged in this particular activity. Of course, the activity should not be a sinful activity. It should be a pious activity. So, engaged in any pious activity, one should think, Krishna is engaging me in this activity. So, think of Krishna. Now, how to think of Krishna? By chanting Hare Krishna, Hare Krishna, Krishna Krishna, Hare Hare. Hare Rama, Hare Rama, Rama Rama, Hare Hare. This can be done by everyone. This should be done by everyone. That is the scriptural direction. Hare Nama, Hare Nama, Hare Namaiva Kevalam.

segments.key_quote: In this way, one can actually engage in the service of the Lord and that way become free from all miseries.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by reiterating that engaging in the service of the Lord leads to freedom from misery and ends with Hare Krishna.
segments.transcript: In this way, one can actually engage in the service of the Lord and that way become free from all miseries. I will stop here. Thank you very much.
